Present location: BIBLIOTHECA ALEXANDRINA ANTIQUETIES MUSEUM [01/027] ALEXANDRIA BAAM
Name: Jar for Holding Liquids
Description: A small jar that has a high cylindrical neck, a moderately high round body and a single handle. Both sides of the body are decorated with geometrical motifs consisting of arrowheads formed by dots, the arrowheads are directed both upwards and downwards. It was part of the table service and was used to serve liquids. Such jars were commonly used all through the Hellenistic period, and many were produced in local ateliers.
